result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon A Olds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume/posses any alcohol. 

The defendant may not enter any tavern or bars or similar establishments.
The defendant must take all medication as prescribed.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA meeting per week and report on a monthly basis to his probation agent.

The defendant must follow through with all after care recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
All conditions the same as count 1 with no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Count 1

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation extended for 1 year

Defendant Brandon A Olds in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:27 AM. Jessica Wagoner, from DOC appears by telephone. Wagoner is asking for extension of probation due to fines not being paid. Olds objects to extension. Court has Olds sworn in, 11:28 AM. Olds indicates he has been struggling financialy and explains why he feels probaiton should not be extended. Court questions Olds. Wagoner makes statement in regards to purchases/recent loan. Court questions what current balance is $1459.88. Court extends probation for one year for reasons stated on the record however DOC can petition court to discharge from probation once paid in full. Wagoner agrees once paid in full, DE would be discharged from probation. DOC to prepare order.
from P&P requesting to appear telephonically - approved
Hearing on April 10, 2017 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt: From DOC asking to amend JOC to add DNA surcharges. Approved by Judge.
JH -
State's Settlement Recommendation
Undecided
Quashed in court.

Defendant Brandon A Olds in court with attorney Mary L Burns. Charles Simono appears for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:35 a.m. Burns makes statement. Matter has been resolved. Court quashes warrant. Count 1 & 2 plead as alleged and dismiss and read in count 3. Count 1 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years on each count. Conditions $300 plus costs, 50 days credit jail time if revoked, AODA and follow through, no possession of alcohol, no entry into bar/tavern and 150 hours community service, take all medications as prescribed by doctor, weekly AA/NA meetings and report to PO on monthly basis. Defendant pleads guilty on counts 1 & 2, Court dismisses and reads in count 3. Court goes through plea questionnaire and finds the defendant is entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently. Waives right to jury trial. Accepts plea and adjudges guilty. State and Burns make final statement. Olds makes statement, asks for probation to be transfered to Wausau.  Court accepts joint recommendation. Court sentences to the following - With hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years on each count - concurrent. Conditions Count 1 - $300 plus costs, 50 days credit jail time if revoked, AODA and follow through, no possession of alcohol, no entry into bar/tavern and 150 hours community service, take all medications as prescribed by doctor, weekly AA/NA meetings and report to PO on monthly basis, with job search. Count 2 - With held sentence place on probation for 3 years concurrent to count 1, same conditions with no additional community service and costs only. Voting/fiream rights given, right to appeal, no DNA sample or costs.

Called at 11:52 AM. Brandon Olds does not appear but his attorney Burns does appear. State appears by Charles Simono. State - ask to forfeit any bond if posted, warrant body or $3000.00. Burns - believes he got ATR to Koinonia. Court - bench warrant, body or $1,000.00.
State's
Final pre-trial on April 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Same conditions as previously ordered.

Defendant Brandon A Olds in court with attorney Mary L. Burns.  Charles J. Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:59 pm. Burns provides waiver of preliminary hearing. State files information (mirrors). Court goes thru waiver and finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Defendant has information and waives further reading - proceed to arraignment - pleads NG to charges. Burns requests bond reduction, defendant is on PO hold and Burns is working on ATR right now and what defendant has to do to retain custody of his child - asks for signature bond or very low cash bond. State feels some cash would be appropriate. $3000 sig with same conditiosn.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Copies sent to DA and Defendant's Attorney.
and certificate of appearance - W.V.

Called at 11:15 AM. Brandon Olds appears via video from FOSO and his counsel Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns has complaint but Olds does not. Court reads charges and penalties. Burns waives further reading, requests PH, is on PO hold. Court continues bond, set for PH on 2/12/14 at 3:00 PM.
No consumption of alcohol. May not etner Mole Lake Casino except in the course of employment.
cash bond set
